meanings.definition: Used by the speaker to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people as the object of a verb or preposition.
meanings.sent1: She gave us a gift on our birthday.
meanings.sent2: Can you please help us with our homework?
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks us humans are strange creatures.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the forest welcomed us with open arms.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reminded us to always be kind to others.

meanings.definition: Used to refer to the speaker and one or more other people as the indirect object of a verb.
meanings.sent1: He told us a funny joke yesterday.
meanings.sent2: They sang us a beautiful song at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The dog considers us his loyal companions.
meanings.sent4: The stars above seem to guide us on our journey.
meanings.sent5: The chef promised us a delicious meal for dinner.

meanings.definition: Used to refer to the speaker and one or more other people as the object of a verb or preposition.
meanings.sent1: Mom baked us cookies for dessert.
meanings.sent2: Dad always reads us bedtime stories.
meanings.sent3: The aliens find us fascinating creatures on Earth.
meanings.sent4: The ocean waves gently carried us to shore.
meanings.sent5: The map showed us the way to the hidden treasure.
